document.title: Archdiocese of Milwaukee Curriculum Guide, Grade 2

AF547D950ADF460FB6A76E19AA571D06.description: Answer a question using information from a provided source or multiple sources

3D861B3F7F8B4B20B892F8B291319137.description: Answer a question recalling information from experiences

2F62E07BA28F4626A0B54C98EA595DCC.description: Recall information from experiences or gather information from provided sources to answer a question.

1D26F268D64949258C49F7110364A404.description: Participate in shared research and writing projects

AA362600DB4A46B98F1C1DE56FCACA06.description: Organize relevant information on a topic

13D319696D6C43C29518F4E321CD58C5.description: Apply sources and tools to conduct shared research on a single topic

1798B3B4E14A4AFEA4CFE1AAC3479C96.description: Participate in shared research and writing projects (e.g., read a number of books on a single topic to produce a report; record science observations).

39794CCCE23E4BCAA62FDBF4DCFF04DE.description: Use technology to produce and publish writing individually and with peers

ABAAD7C50D734315AACB0FA2D5F2B368.description: Choose digital tools for producing and publishing writing

A0002F73DFD7493B9AEAEE867CEEC4E7.description: With guidance and support from adults, use a variety of digital tools to produce and publish writing, including in collaboration with peers.

793467CF8C6545798E5606A3BC08D1BC.description: Recognize how to revise and edit

AB8F543F036847588A9A8954E18386E3.description: Recognize how to focus on a topic

E40A9C6E1BF34BBE89D1732C8E60BB24.description: With guidance and support from adults and peers, focus on a topic and strengthen writing as needed by revising and editing.

3C779C297BA34F41BB93C7A1E889DECF.description: Write a narrative that includes supporting details, temporal words, and a sense of closure

1FF1F47B8B014D34BAF7E6694CB16C73.description: Write a narrative that recounts a well-elaborated event or short sequence of events

EDE593BF2CEF4A658D9429B0B492F355.description: Create relevant and elaborated details to support events of a narrative

FD4BECF19FC84916A849CF1DD7AFCE1D.description: Apply appropriate temporal words in order to signal change of events in a narrative

0596A958422B4BF1AD27DBE19E549024.description: Choose relevant details that correspond to a chosen event

1132A6C8A1884BEBAF3817E4A2542C20.description: Identify components of narrative including beginning and ending

CEC20DF130E54460A1B9B8E272E526F2.description: Write narratives in which they recount a well-elaborated event or short sequence of events, include details to describe actions, thoughts, and feelings, use temporal words to signal event order, and provide a sense of closure.

EC80218ADEFF4E288C1CB1EC3B0C774C.description: Write informative/explanatory texts that include a concluding statement or section

CC490EE2ED2843F78FA5D85C609D078A.description: Write informative/explanatory texts that use facts and definitions to develop the topic

59DA31840BD248B49BA8D05BE06B6BD8.description: Write informative/explanatory texts that focus on a specific topic

9809626F685D48D4B70A999B9CBEDDB5.description: Determine an appropriate concluding statement or section

797507F7841441E6B0C7EBF5C81DBEF5.description: Use facts and definitions to develop points

19C8102F4D944C5FBD557385138FB0BB.description: Write informative/explanatory texts in which they introduce a topic, use facts and definitions to develop points, and provide a concluding statement or section.

E7FD6E45EB634D22AA0FCBD1A3245B8A.description: Write an opinion piece which provides a concluding statement or section

3E702804046445318603E00061FF0E74.description: Write an opinion piece which uses effective words to link opinions and reasons

8E7FA5E7642C4F2A8732BDD4C2916AC3.description: Write an opinion piece which supplies at last 2 supporting reasons for the opinion

710D088B42A8475F9E532AF027CE5BA3.description: Write an opinion piece which introduces the topic or book

134A576375D54081AEA21E868B9D8040.description: Use linking words (e.g. because, and, also) in order to connect opinions and reasons

20EA6CFA4621488AA2F0B867B205FFDE.description: Organize writing to introduce, support, and conclude

1AF313D763444AD8AC30E71E6F9203C1.description: Generate reasons that support stated opinions

122E81992DE24430A049B154F2124BF1.description: Formulate and articulate an opinion about a text or topic

32645BE01D6742AF92D5B1F77E53221F.description: Recognize and define concluding sections or statements

AF3D6A92481444E8A765D7E245F20B69.description: Identify a topic or title of a book to write about

1A0E5721C68340748A6C2CE5B8BA7BCD.description: Write opinion pieces in which they introduce the topic or book they are writing about, state an opinion, supply reasons that support the opinion, use linking words (e.g., because, and, also) to connect opinion and reasons, and provide a concluding statement or section.

C2C7B3B883024FA5975FFF5D42D26976.description: Respond to answer questions or to clarify

57178EE9CCAF4A65A194B90DFF18E26D.description: Produce complete sentences when appropriate to task and situation in order to provide requested detail or clarification. (See grade 2 Language standards 1 and 3 here for specific expectations.)

8305E5B14E134610AB20E48B1D84153A.description: Create audio recordings of stories or poems

1FE967AC744B4567B030DEAF1CE22C63.description: Clarify ideas, thoughts, and feelings by adding drawings/visual displays

457BC13EAB4445F2B152D80A6EFA66C1.description: Create audio recordings of stories or poems; add drawings or other visual displays to stories or recounts of experiences when appropriate to clarify ideas, thoughts, and feelings.

41CBF40DDF694FDC87CD496314068AFE.description: Tell a story or recount an experience with appropriate facts and relevant, descriptive details, speaking audibly in coherent sentences.
